website_summaries.verdict: Band saw blade made from premium grade steel and optimized tooth geometry for your toughest jobs.
pros: Blade is made from premium grade steel to resist heat buildup, prolonging blade life
Optimized tooth geometry for best performance during cutting
Manufacturer states their saw blades are designed to fit most popular brand band saws, including 9" and 10" band saws
cons: Slightly over 15% of buyers were disappointed by the product, mainly because it didn't hold up to making cuts through metal
On the costlier end of price range

customer_reviews.title: Very good blade
customer_reviews.text: So far these are holding up better than any other blade I have tried. We have even cut some 2" round bar which at 24tpi is not an ideal match. This blade not only cut it with ease it did it quick that a more suitable blade on the same material. So far after a couple hundred cuts it shows no signs of dulling. Make sure you have it tracking correctly and don't over feed it. I think a lot of Bands that go dull are from people expecting to much and over feeding.
customer_reviews.author: Ollbuster

customer_reviews.title: One good, one bad
customer_reviews.text: Bosch branding carries a high reputation for quality in my shop. This item doesn't meet that standard. I bought two blades, one of which has a crack beginning at the tooth edge of the weld. It isn't worth my time repackaging and shipping it back. I am disappointed in the quality control. Perhaps customer service will make this right. We'll have to see. If so, I'll let you all know.
customer_reviews.author: Selkie

customer_reviews.title: This blade saved a Horizontal Bandsaw (and my money) from the trash.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a cheap Harbor Freight Horizontal Bandsaw. It didn't work very well with the factory blade. It would run, but if you tried to cut anything the blade would bind and pop off wheels and wouldn't track. I put this Bosch Bandsaw Blade on the Horizontal Saw and now it cuts perfectly. I haven't lost tracking once and I've been cutting for weeks. Bosch for the win!
customer_reviews.author: Diacis

customer_reviews.title: I use to like these, reasonable yes but rather short life.
customer_reviews.text: This blade worked very well and arrived quickly. I have not had the opportunity to address the longevity however so far so good. An update I have been pleased with these blades in the past however this one lasted about a week and then for some reason it fractured right down the center. The teeth were still good however it will not cut straight and I do not believe it is safe to use.
customer_reviews.author: Rusted Nut Garage

customer_reviews.title: JUNKYEST JUNK I EVER SEEN
customer_reviews.text: PIECE OF CRAP BLADES ! NO quality control at the company that made them or else they would of not let the blades I got be shipped. The welds were so far off it ended up destroying my guide bearings which then allowed the blade to slip off the vertical bearing that rides on backside of blade . And I needed that blade for a piece i needed cut for a customer so had no choice but to use it one time and thats all it took
customer_reviews.author: Gary & Sue Cutler

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic value
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased blades for my bandsaw from discount stores trying to be frugal,. I cut a lot of 1/4" to 1 1/2 " steel and stainless steel. I usually replace the blade after every tenth cut or so. These blades really showed me the difference in their value. these were about $9.00 more each but I have been using the first one, since it arrived and still cutting great. made over 25 cuts and its not slowing down.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: working well so far
customer_reviews.text: Other reviews mentioned that this blade was too fine and cut slow. I find that it is a little slower, but it cuts with less jamming and jumping off the drive wheel of the bandsaw. It might not be the best blade for steel over 1/2 inch thick, but for under that it works fine on my saw.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Working good for me.
customer_reviews.text: I can quite understand, the bad reviews. I tried this blade, it’s working fine. I cut mostly cold roll and I haven’t had a problem. If I was cutting, hot roll it would cut like butter. All I can figure is there head isn’t balanced, but even if I push within reason, it works fine. So I will buy again
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Block

customer_reviews.title: great blade with a terrible Achilles heel.  inspect for crack by factory weld before for installing!
customer_reviews.text: Blade has very high quality teeth, made out of a great metal for cutting most metals. I used mine to cut unistrut, all thread rod, and unistrut brackets. It held up well for about a week and it now gets caught, or makes a horrible sound where the blade was welded at the factory and is beginning to split. I find this level of longevity unacceptable, especially when the cheap Chinese blade that came with this harbor freight saw lasted two years. I slacked this blade after each use and only tightened it enough so it would not slip! if only they welded it together better...
customer_reviews.author: M. Woodcock

customer_reviews.title: Ok not stellar
customer_reviews.text: Blade did good till it broke at weld, this blade size is for the China made bandsaw from HF , that being said I think if it were on a quality machine it would have better performance
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Walker

customer_reviews.title: Good blades, great price
customer_reviews.text: My saw blades were delivered very quick. Cut excellent, but don’t know about longevity since I have only used one time. Though they seem to be high quality blades, and cut smooth and quick.
customer_reviews.author: goldenhawk

customer_reviews.title: It was a hardback blade.
customer_reviews.text: I'm always shopping for a bargain. I thought I had found one. I didn't realize until they arrived that they were hardback blades. I determined long ago that for cutting steel a hardback blade is a poor choice. These blades confirmed that fact. Maybe for plastic or aluminum they would be okay but they don't hold up in steel.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Blades had no durability
customer_reviews.text: Stock blade that came with the hack saw lasted over a year. Put one of these blades on my saw and first one was soft and bent immediately and the 2nd one the teeth came off immediately. I am cutting soft steel so these blades should have worked. Neither blade finished a cut. Very disappointed in the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia I. Garner

customer_reviews.title: worst bandsaw blade I ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: I installed this blade in my wilton horizontal and started a cut through a 2" diameter exhaust pipe and by the time the blade penetrated the thinwall pipe approximately 5/16" depth the blade stopped cutting. The teeth were absolutely shot, I finished sawing trough the pipe with my hacksaw a dull hacksaw blade and it cut through the pipe with no problem. I expected much more out of a bosch blade. This blade was garbage..
customer_reviews.author: gary m.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect blade. Sharp and well made good steel.
customer_reviews.text: Only way the blade could be better if it were Carbide tipped. Fit my Metal band saw and eats through steel and aluminium.
customer_reviews.author: Gandolf

customer_reviews.title: Horrible blades!
customer_reviews.text: These blades are absolute garbage. Even the Harbor freight blades lasted 10 times longer. They loose a edge quickly and wander off at an angle. I have never had worse blades for Mike steel.
customer_reviews.author: tracy o doriot

customer_reviews.title: I used to buy these and they would never last that long when cutting thru welds
customer_reviews.text: I used to buy these and they would never last that long when cutting thru welds. Now I use these bi-metal blades "" and am still on my first one!
customer_reviews.author: WTFOver

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I've used a few diff brands until I found this one. Last longer, cuts better. Use oil while cutting and relief cuts.
customer_reviews.author: James G. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Wrong size.
customer_reviews.text: Could you check my order. I thought I ordered an 80 inch blade. I am not returning item as I might know someone who could use the 64 1/2. AM NOT DOING A RETURN Thank you. Ray
customer_reviews.author: Ray Ojeda

customer_reviews.title: Good blade for the money. Holds up well.
customer_reviews.text: Makes a really smooth cut but it's a little bit slower because it has so many teeth per inch. I couldn't find any blades with less teeth per inch in this price range. But it's so cheap I couldn't turn it down and it works really good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonfive

customer_reviews.title: Nice Blade!
customer_reviews.text: Great blade. I got this to replace the stock blade on a Harbor Freight table bandsaw. The old one was okay... it cut pretty fast, but the cuts needed a lot of cleanup, and it seemed like the blade lost 10% of its teeth every cut! This blade, on the other hand, cuts a tiny bit slower -- it's a higher TPI count, so that makes sense -- but the cuts are buttery-smooth, and after about 100-150 cuts on 1/8" mild steel, as far as I can tell, it still has *all* its teeth. Nice!
customer_reviews.author: Talbot T. Canham

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again
customer_reviews.text: They do their job. After a few minutes to setup my new saw's guides, this blade cut as well as I think it should. After breaking 2 blades on my saw, this blade has cut multiple items for 2 days now without any noticeable fitigue. Will/would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Davis

customer_reviews.title: Good, but a bit brittle
customer_reviews.text: Don't push too hard or the teeth will begin breaking off. A bit brittle but useful if care is taken.
customer_reviews.author: Terry M. Van Blaricom

customer_reviews.title: Tough.
customer_reviews.text: Use it for various farm sawing operations. Some other brands fail quickly, this one is lasting a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Schmitz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this blade several times now, and will continue to purchase it as needed. It is by far the best blade I have ever used in terms of reliability. If I wasn't so rough on my blades I'm sure could manage 1000's of cuts with it. This is used on a JET horizontal band saw.
customer_reviews.author: The Driver

customer_reviews.title: Waist of money
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of crap! Cutting a bolt and got half way trough it and then stoped. All the teeth were gone. Something I’ve done a hundred times with the old blade. Got a kink in it so I thought I should replace it. Put it back on to finish the job. Don’t waist your money like I did.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn S.

customer_reviews.title: Cut to the chase
customer_reviews.text: This is the best blade for mild steel. Period. I like to run a blade at lowered speed and this one will cut perfectly. I'm fabricating and sometimes duplicating parts for an old race plane. When I want to cut a precise, straight line, this is the go-to blade.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Florey

customer_reviews.title: however the Imachinist S64514 Bi-metal Band Saw Blade works fine. So i believe these will be good & ...
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used them yet,however the Imachinist S64514 Bi-metal Band Saw Blade works fine.So i believe these will be good & last a little while so long as i don't apply ridiculous pressure to the cut nor over speed the blade
customer_reviews.author: scorpNZ

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money spent.
customer_reviews.text: At 24TPI, it does take longer to finish a cut, but that high tooth count also allows me to use it on a variety of metals while maintaining clean cuts. Durability seems to be very good as long as you have your saw set up correctly.
customer_reviews.author: NorthTxRaider

customer_reviews.title: They are junk
customer_reviews.text: These blades have dead spots where there are no teeth and it makes the saw bounce then you don't get a good cut. I'm not buying Bosch any more. A waste of money and time
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Product has worked fine so far. It is being used in a backyard shop cutting mostly HR Steel products.
customer_reviews.author: Troublesome

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work decently well, nothing special. HD stopped selling theirs, so I had to find a new blade supplier for my harbor freight band saw. It fits the red one, and hasn't broken yet...but I also haven't done a huge deal of cutting with it. Bottom line - If you need blades for your red HF band saw because HD stopped selling them, then buy this. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: GARBAGE!!! STAY AWAY!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been trying out different blades on my HF saw. This blade is the worst I’ve tried yet! 10 cuts through 16gauge 2” square tubing and it’s shot.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Nelson III

customer_reviews.title: The weld joint finally broke
customer_reviews.text: Worked good until the weld joint broke. I have a backup of the same make. Will be looking for another brand to use after this one breaks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last more than 4 cuts of soft steel
customer_reviews.text: The band worked great for the first cuts of high carbon steel then it wouldn't cut butter
customer_reviews.author: expertauto

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good so far.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Fast shipping and quality product, but a bit expensive. Only made half a dozen cuts through 1.5" angle iron, seems to be holding up ok so far.
customer_reviews.author: daniel r haller

customer_reviews.title: Cracked Splice
customer_reviews.text: Great shipping, came on time. Went to use band saw blade and weld was cracked. Poor quality workmanship to let this item out the front door. "DON'T BUY THIS ITEM"
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The one to buy!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried four brands for my band saw, and this one has lasted significantly longer than the others. I'll be able to tell you by how much when it finally fails... You won't be disappointed. It's absolutely the best bang for the buck, try it!
customer_reviews.author: Cliff

customer_reviews.title: Bar stock looks like pac man
customer_reviews.text: Saw cut straight before this buy and bearings (also from amazon), has'nt cut straight since. Not even close . But will cut the weirdest, craziest shapes you've ever seen. Bar stock looks like pac man.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Good to go on my Harbor Freight metal cutting saw. Good price, good value
customer_reviews.text: So far, good to go. It has been a horse on my Harbor Freight metal saw, and cut all the steel that I have put to it. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Paul S. Brzozowski

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Last.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use when cutting 0.065” wall piping. Unfortunately each blade lasted for 2 cuts before all the teeth were gone. Not only that, but none of the cuts were straight. Will not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Blade seems only suitable for light material. It's brand new cut a few 1/8 angles and hollow section with no problem. Tried to cut a 1/4" angle and the blade just failed couldn't cut more than 1/2" of the 2" angle.
customer_reviews.author: kirk m.

customer_reviews.title: Pop way too easy
customer_reviews.text: There is much better blades on Amazon for a few dollars more.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Durability
customer_reviews.text: I'm embarrassed this blade didn't come close to the HF one in durability.
customer_reviews.author: SwoD

customer_reviews.title: Cut one piece of mild steel1/8 inch thick. Cut ...
customer_reviews.text: Cut one piece of mild steel1/8 inch thick. Cut one piece.of copper, same size. There are NO teeth left on this blade....these are junk for metal cutting
customer_reviews.author: Mike Pardue

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than 5 minutes
customer_reviews.text: It lost teeth on the second piece of 1.5 x 1.5 x 1/8" angle. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Iggyroo2000

customer_reviews.title: Keep looking
customer_reviews.text: They cut everything slowly and gum up all the time, but they make up for that by constantly braking.
customer_reviews.author: aaron k

customer_reviews.title: Excellent blade
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality blade, cuts like a dream. No steel is a match for this blade. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jonboy1919

customer_reviews.title: Some assembly required?
customer_reviews.text: Mine came in one continuous blade. No loop. I thought Bosch was supposed to be a premium product.
customer_reviews.author: Tommywon

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought the double pack. Only used one blade so far. Teeth started to come off at the weld after about 8 cuts of soft mild steel tubing. Thought if it were Bosch the quality would be good. Will never buy again.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: WORKS GREAT AND DOESNOT HAVE THE BUMP WHERE WELDED TOGETHER LIKE ...
customer_reviews.text: WORKS GREAT AND DOESNOT HAVE THE BUMP WHERE WELDED TOGETHER LIKE OTHERS THAT I HAVE USED WILL REORDER THIS SAME PRODUCT AGAIN
customer_reviews.author: TOM MCINTURFF

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt last long before they break!
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 blades, both broke at weld after only a few days use. will not be buying again!
customer_reviews.author: Alan M.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality blades. The first one broke during install at the weld seam. The second blade ran ok for a time, but broke after moderate use. The weld seam on the second blade was crooked causing the saw to bog slightly when the blade seam passed the cut.
customer_reviews.author: Buck Greenway

customer_reviews.title: Wrong blade in the right package.
customer_reviews.text: The package was correct, but inside was a 8 tpi wood cutting bandsaw blade instead of a 24 tpi metal cutting blade. NOT HAPPY!!! I would give 0 stars if I could!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP MADE
customer_reviews.text: cut 1st piece of metal and blade teeth stripped. Good thing I purchased more than one. Will buy a different brand next time
customer_reviews.author: David M. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Won't cut straight- multiple blades.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these in the past and they were fine for the price. Last time I ordered 2 replacements, both have uneven teeth and pull strongly in one direction. Can't be used to cut straight.
customer_reviews.author: Hammer

customer_reviews.title: These are great quality blades
customer_reviews.text: These are great quality blades. my own fault for wrecking one by trying to cut a Titanium turbine blade. Everything else I have cut they work great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Blade
customer_reviews.text: This is a great blade for sawing hard steels and thin material (thin materials need more teeth per inch to prevent blade dulling). For general purpose use, I use the Olsen 18TPI blades. (18TPI cuts faster). Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Scott (Technogeek)Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Sharp deal.
customer_reviews.text: Been running this blade for a few hundred cuts so far. I've already bought two more as backup.
customer_reviews.author: Kierstena Rolfson

customer_reviews.title: If your looking for quality look somewhere else
customer_reviews.text: Out of 12 blades purchased three had cracked welds before installation and broke after a couple cuts, one had weld on the teeth causing it to skip when cutting, and one was 1 1/2 inches too long, so could not be installed on the saw. As for the rest, they worked well until the blades broke.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: One of the better metal cutting blades that I have used.
customer_reviews.author: MO Buyer

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME BLADE! CUTS STAINLESS EASY.
customer_reviews.text: awesome band saw blade! i use it to cut 3 inch stainless and its like butter. will buy again!
customer_reviews.author: wade

customer_reviews.title: Spend the money for a real blade
customer_reviews.text: Worst blade I have ever purchased. 10 on a 2 in .065 wall stainless tube and it didn't even cut into the tube and teeth are to dull to do anything.
customer_reviews.author: tim

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works and fits perfect for the band saw machine I ordered it for
customer_reviews.author: Michael Conte

customer_reviews.title: Just didn't last at all.
customer_reviews.text: It simply did not last at all. It made 5 cuts through 2.5" 16g 304 exhaust pipe and was dull beyond belief. :(
customer_reviews.author: Ham Peddler

customer_reviews.title: Inferior blade
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money on this. I ordered one of these and a Starrett blade. This blade seems to be a little bit too long bottoming the tensioner out on my bandsaw. There are better products out there than this blade.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Goins

customer_reviews.title: Really Good Bandsaw Blade
customer_reviews.text: Easy to find with Amazon for my 4 inch metal bandsaw.
customer_reviews.author: Sully

customer_reviews.title: Better than bi-metal
customer_reviews.text: Since the saw I bought these for was not generally used for cutting wood, a bi-metal blade was a waste of money. These blade cut metal better and last longer than those that came with my saw. The price was also better, so it was a win win.
customer_reviews.author: BJ

customer_reviews.title: some strip the teeth pretty quickly and are worthless
customer_reviews.text: The quality control seems a little shakey. Some last through many cuts, some strip the teeth pretty quickly and are worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Buffalo

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery, installed it and it cuts 1/4 inch aluminum plate nice and clean
customer_reviews.author: BW

customer_reviews.title: Works great on my harbor freight band saw
customer_reviews.text: Works great on my harbor freight band saw. The blade is good (as long as you don't force the cut) and stays sharp for a good long time.
customer_reviews.author: RegularJoe

customer_reviews.title: Don't wast your time and money, one blade didn't ...
customer_reviews.text: Don't wast your time and money , one blade didn't finish cutting thin wall wall one inch square tubing , checked blade there were no teeth on blade , never again will I buy this blade again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting
customer_reviews.text: Reasonably priced and good quality. I have cut a lot of angle iron and 2" tubing and the blade still cuts well.
customer_reviews.author: Harold W. Melius

customer_reviews.title: not very good
customer_reviews.text: you get what you pay for not very good. spend twice as much its a lot cheaper
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needs to use better steel or something
customer_reviews.text: I cut 2 pieces of steel and that was it,they were leaf springs only 3 " cuts ,2 of them
customer_reviews.author: Chuck johnson

customer_reviews.title: Keeps on Working
customer_reviews.text: Excellent !!! Really lasts a long time.....still going strong....a Great Blade !!!
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Cutting ability of band saw blade
customer_reviews.text: The saw blade met all my expectation. It cuts all metals efficiently. I will probably buy another one when this blade wears out.
customer_reviews.author: GERALD FALBEL

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Made a fee cuts and then broke. ..I gave never seen a band saw blade break and it wasn't even on the weld
customer_reviews.author: CWA

customer_reviews.title: lasted about 10 cuts on some 14 ga mild steel ...
customer_reviews.text: lasted about 10 cuts on some 14 ga mild steel 3 inches wide before crapping out. Not for any real med or heavy use
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade.
customer_reviews.text: Turned my cheap and finicky harbor freight bandsaw into a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie D

customer_reviews.title: It's not your saw
customer_reviews.text: If you think it is that your saw is too cheap or it is out of alignment that may be true but it is probably this blade. I have used every suggestion and method to set up my drop saw with no success. It never cut straight or smoothly. I have been through 3 of these blades now. One did ok, two others lost significant amount of teeth. Like many others I thought I was doing something wrong until I tried a different brand. Just put in an Olsen 18 TPI last night and got the straightest smoothest cut I have ever got out of my China made saw (even older than HF)
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Buchanan

customer_reviews.title: Good blade for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a good blade for the price. Slight discontinuity where blade is joined but has not caused any problems
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Rinehart

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Ordered for back up, but expect it to be ok
customer_reviews.author: Opa Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Great find
customer_reviews.text: This item is hard to find in my area. So I was glad to find it on Amazon. Good quality and fair price.
customer_reviews.author: DeWalter White

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: very nice exactly as advertised quick delivery couldn't be happier
customer_reviews.author: Richard Burdick

customer_reviews.title: Great for finer finish cutting as well as thin wall stuff
customer_reviews.text: Use this blade on my Grizzly stand alone metal band saw to cut thinner walled tubing and aluminum at the propper speeds. works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: worked great, only 64 in. but I made them to fit anyway. Thanks. Great to do business with you. I will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Sarge

customer_reviews.title: Quick ship!
customer_reviews.text: We use these in our shop to cut the metal. They ship quick and last!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Zehr

customer_reviews.title: Replacement blade for band saw
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bosch blade to replace the cheapy blade that came with a new JET horizontal band saw. The Bosch has held up very well. I cut tons of 1" box steel tubing and the original Taiwanese blade lasted about 2 days. The bosch has lasted significantly longer about a week of pretty intense work (couple hours a day), but is snowing some loss of teeth. I will be ordering more its a good blade... i wish the bosch came in other than 24TPI.
customer_reviews.author: K. Smolenski

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Just put it on my bandsaw and works great, took me a little while to adjust the tension, but that has nothing to do with the blade
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Fit on my saw just fine.
customer_reviews.text: Blades were delivered on time and were exactly as advertised. Fit on my saw just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jim G

customer_reviews.title: ... my Step Dad and he said they were a great product!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered these for my Step Dad and he said they were a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great blade, especially for the price!
customer_reviews.text: In my limited experience with my band saw, this is without a doubt the best blade I have used. Cuts 1/8 mild steel cleanly and quickly!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product that holds up well for many metal cuts.
customer_reviews.author: Donald

customer_reviews.title: Bosh metal band saw blade
customer_reviews.text: bandsaw blade arrived safely and on time, works well, I will recomend to others and I will order more thankyou
customer_reviews.author: Greig

product_meta.title: Bosch BS6412-24M 64-1/2-Inch by 1/2-Inch by 24TPI Metal Bandsaw Blade
product_meta.description:
Bosch brand band saw blades are made from premium grade steel that resists heat buildup which provides long life for the blade. The unique tooth geometry is optimized for the best performance during cutting. A variety of sizes and types are offered to cover wood and metal applications. Bosch band saw blades are designed to fit most popular brand band saws, including 9-Inch and 10-Inch band saws.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Bosch brand band saw blades are made from premium grade steel that resists heat buildup which provides long life for the blade. The unique tooth geometry is optimized for the best performance during cutting. A variety of sizes and types are offered to cover wood and metal applications. Bosch band saw blades are designed to fit most popular brand band saws, including 9-Inch and 10-Inch band saws.
feature_bullets: Resists heat build up for longer life
Optimized tooth geometry for best cutting performance
Package Dimensions: 2.794 L x 26.797 H x 24.765 W (centimeters)

specifications.Included Components: Bosch BS6412-24M 64-1/2-Inch by 1/2-Inch by 24TPI Metal Bandsaw Blade
